title: Present simple: 'have got'
description: Practice using 'have got' and 'has got' for possession, appearance, family, and timetabled events.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
questions.explanation: Use 'has got' for he/she/it.

questions.question: Complete: I _____ (have got) brown hair.
questions.explanation: Use 'have got' for I/you/we/they.

questions.question: Which is the correct negative form?
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Complete: They _____ (have got) a new car.
questions.explanation: Use 'have got' for they.

questions.question: Which question is correct?
questions.explanation: Use 'Have/Has + subject + got' for questions.

questions.question: Complete: My sister _____ (has got) long hair.
questions.explanation: Use 'has got' for he/she/it.

questions.question: Which is the correct contracted form?
questions.explanation: The correct contraction is 'I've got'.

questions.question: Complete: She _____ (not got) a brother.
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Which is correct?

choices: We've got basketball practice this evening.
We has got basketball practice this evening.
We got basketball practice this evening.
We have basketball practice this evening.

questions.answer: We've got basketball practice this evening.
questions.explanation: Use 'have got' or contraction 'We've got' for we.

questions.question: Complete: He _____ (has got) a terrible cold.
questions.explanation: Use 'has got' for he/she/it.

questions.question: Which is the correct negative contracted form?
questions.explanation: Use 'haven't got' for I/you/we/they in negatives.

questions.question: Complete: _____ you got a new job?
questions.explanation: Use 'Have' for questions with you/we/they.

questions.question: Which is the correct short answer?
questions.explanation: Use 'have' for short answers with I/you/we/they.

questions.question: Complete: Has she got _____ friends?
questions.explanation: Use 'many' with countable nouns in questions.

questions.question: Arrange the words: 'They / have / got / a / new / car'
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is 'They have got a new car.'

questions.question: Which is correct?

choices: He have got a good job.

questions.explanation: Use 'has got' or contraction 'He's got' for he/she/it.

questions.question: Complete: I _____ (not got) any idea.
questions.explanation: Use 'haven't got' for I/you/we/they in negatives.

questions.question: Which is the correct question form?
questions.explanation: Use 'What have you got?' for questions.

questions.question: Complete: She _____ (not got) a brother.
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Arrange the words: 'I / have / got / brown / hair'
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is 'I have got brown hair.'

questions.question: Which is the correct negative form for 'they'?
questions.explanation: Use 'haven't got' for I/you/we/they in negatives.

questions.question: Complete: _____ she got a meeting this morning?

content.sentence: _____ she got a meeting this morning?

questions.explanation: Use 'Has' for he/she/it in questions.

questions.question: Which is the correct contracted negative form for 'he'?
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Complete: We _____ (have got) a big garden.
questions.explanation: Use 'have got' for we.

questions.question: Which is the correct question form for 'it'?
questions.explanation: Use 'Has' for he/she/it in questions.

questions.question: Complete: You _____ (not got) any pets.
questions.explanation: Use 'haven't got' for you/we/they in negatives.

questions.question: Which is the correct short answer for 'Has she got a car?'
questions.explanation: Use 'has' for he/she/it in short answers.

questions.question: Complete: They _____ (not got) any money.
questions.explanation: Use 'haven't got' for they in negatives.

questions.question: Which is the correct question form for 'we'?
questions.explanation: Use 'Have' for I/you/we/they in questions.

questions.question: Complete: My parents _____ (have got) a house in the countryside.

content.sentence: My parents _____ a house in the countryside.

questions.explanation: Use 'have got' for plural subjects.

questions.question: Which is the correct negative form for 'it'?
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Complete: _____ they got any children?
questions.explanation: Use 'Have' for they in questions.

questions.question: Which is the correct contracted form for 'we'?
questions.explanation: Use 'We've got' as the contraction for 'we have got'.

questions.question: Complete: He _____ (not got) any sisters.
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Arrange the words: 'She / has / got / a / good / idea'
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is 'She has got a good idea.'

questions.question: Which is the correct question form for 'he'?
questions.explanation: Use 'Has' for he/she/it in questions.

questions.question: Complete: I _____ (not got) a pet.
questions.explanation: Use 'haven't got' for I/you/we/they in negatives.

questions.question: Which is the correct negative contracted form for 'she'?
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Complete: We _____ (have got) a lot of homework.
questions.explanation: Use 'have got' for we.

questions.question: Arrange the words: 'He / has / got / a / terrible / cold'
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is 'He has got a terrible cold.'

questions.question: Which is the correct question form for 'they'?
questions.explanation: Use 'Have' for they in questions.

questions.question: Complete: She _____ (has got) a lot of friends.
questions.explanation: Use 'has got' for he/she/it.

questions.question: Which is the correct negative form for 'I'?
questions.explanation: Use 'haven't got' for I/you/we/they in negatives.

questions.question: Complete: _____ he got a new job?
questions.explanation: Use 'Has' for he/she/it in questions.

questions.question: Which is the correct contracted form for 'they'?

choices: They has got a new house.
They have got a new house.

questions.explanation: Use 'They've got' as the contraction for 'they have got'.

questions.question: Complete: He _____ (not got) any pets.
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Which is the correct question form for 'you'?
questions.explanation: Use 'Have' for you in questions.

questions.question: Complete: I _____ (have got) a good idea.
questions.explanation: Use 'have got' for I/you/we/they.

questions.question: Which is the correct negative contracted form for 'it'?
questions.explanation: Use 'hasn't got' for he/she/it in negatives.

questions.question: Arrange the words: 'We / have / not / got / any / pets'
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is 'We have not got any pets.'
